ResourceHeader.ResourceName: STEREO-B IMPACT (In-Situ Measurements of Particles and CME Transients) Solar Electron Proton Telescope (SEPT) 1-min Level 1 Electron and Proton Spectra
ResourceHeader.Description: The IMPACT Solar Electron Proton Telescope (SEPT) Level 1 data consist of electron and proton fluxes from each of 32 energy bands that span ~20 keV to 2000(electrons) or 7000(protons) keV. These spectra are determined each minute, in each of 4 directions with 60 deg fields of view (parallel and anti-parallel to the Parker magnetic field direction, and northward and southward from the ecliptic plane.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the IMPACT P.I., Janet Luhmann of UCB

Parameter.Name: Electron spectrum viewing northward from ecliptic plane
Parameter.Description: Electron flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 4000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed northward from the ecliptic plane

Parameter.Name: Electron spectrum viewing southward from ecliptic plane
Parameter.Description: Electron flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 4000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed southward from the ecliptic plane

Parameter.Name: Proton spectrum viewing northward from ecliptic plane
Parameter.Description: Proton flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 7000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed northward from the ecliptic plane

Parameter.Name: Proton spectrum viewing southward from ecliptic plane
Parameter.Description: Proton flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 7000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed southward from the ecliptic plane

Parameter.Name: Electron spectrum viewing sunward along the Parker IMF angle
Parameter.Description: Electron flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 4000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed sunward along the Parker IMF spiral angle

Parameter.Name: Electron spectrum viewing antisunward along the Parker IMF angle
Parameter.Description: Electron flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 4000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed antisunward along the Parker IMF spiral angle

Parameter.Name: Proton spectrum viewing sunward along the Parker IMF angle
Parameter.Description: Proton flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 7000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed sunward along the Parker IMF spiral angle

Parameter.Name: Proton spectrum viewing antisunward along the Parker IMF angle
Parameter.Description: Proton flux in each of 32 energy bands between 20 keV and 7000 keV, from the SEPT sensor pointed antisunward along the Parker IMF spiral angle
